segments.text: I see a woman standing by the sink, completely engrossed in drying a plate.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: She doesn't even seem to notice the water cascading over the edge of the sink.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: It's remarkable how someone can be so focused on a simple task.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: I think about how often we overlook the chaos around us when we're intently focused.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: The puddle at her feet is getting larger, and she remains oblivious.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: Outside the window, the garden looks so peaceful, contrasting the messy kitchen.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: It surprises me that she hasn’t slipped yet; she’s right in that puddle!
segments.speaker: PAR
